page.title: 02Local History-Acton/Gt.Wald.
page.content: The earliest historical evidence in the survey area is a Roman road to the west of Gt.Waldingfield.Both villages are believed to have been settled by the Anglo-Saxons.During the Middle Ages the parish churches were built and it is likely that Little Waldingfield separated to become an independent village.There are many cottages in the area that were built during the Tudor and Stuart periods. At the time of the first census in 1801.Acton had a population of 460 and Gt.Waldingfield 560.Both villages grew little until new housing estates were built from the late 1960's onwards.In 1981 their populations had increased to 1972 for Acton and 1219 for Gt.Waldingfield.Both are still growing. During the last war Acton had a prisoner of war camp and Great Waldingfield was a bomber aerodrome.
